Title: Office Of Student Affairs | REVA University
Content: The Office of Student Affairs (OSA) at REVA University plays a vital role in enhancing the overall student experience by focusing on development beyond the classroom. Our mission is to support students in becoming confident, responsible, and compassionate individuals through a wide range of programs, services, leadership opportunities, and wellness initiatives. At REVA, we believe that education is not limited to academic learning alone. The Office of Student Affairs is dedicated to providing an engaging, inclusive, and supportive environment where students are encouraged to explore their interests, discover their potential, and grow holistically. We work closely with faculty, student clubs, alumni, and external partners to create opportunities that foster personal and professional development. One of the core objectives of the Office is to nurture ethical values and moral responsibility among students. Through community service, student-led initiatives, and mentoring activities, we guide students in building character, developing empathy, and cultivating integrity—qualities that are essential for leadership and lifelong success. REVA University is known for its vibrant campus life, and the Office of Student Affairs is at the center of it. We coordinate a wide spectrum of co-curricular and extracurricular programs ranging from cultural events, student festivals, and leadership summits to wellness campaigns and outreach activities. These engagements enrich the student journey, allowing them to collaborate, lead, and contribute meaningfully to the university community. We are also deeply committed to promoting cultural humility and inclusivity. The diverse student population at REVA brings together voices and experiences from across the country and around the world. The Office of Student Affairs ensures that all students feel respected, valued, and supported regardless of their background, language, or identity. Through cultural clubs, diversity programs, and awareness campaigns, we create a safe space for dialogue, expression, and mutual understanding. Leadership development is a cornerstone of our work. At REVA, students are given the platform to lead through student council, ambassador programs, peer mentorship, and club leadership roles. These experiences help students enhance their confidence, decision-making skills, and sense of responsibility—preparing them for leadership in both professional and social spheres. In essence, the Office of Student Affairs at REVA University is dedicated to nurturing students in all dimensions of life. We are committed to fostering inclusive communities, inspiring personal growth, and supporting every student’s journey toward excellence, empowerment, and success. Contact Details Mr. Jayachandra Head- Office of Student Affairs studentaffairs@reva.edu.in Student Council was a defining experience that shaped my leadership skills, tested my resolve, and ignited my passion for creating positive change. From organizing campus events to advocating for student rights, I worked tirelessly to amplify student voices and foster a sense of community. Through collaborations, negotiations, and problem-solving, I developed a unique blend of creativity, strategic thinking, and interpersonal skills. This journey not only helped me grow as a leader but also instilled in me a lifelong commitment to responsibility, leadership, confidence and empowering others. It was a remarkable journey filled with diverse challenges and opportunities. Leading such a prestigious University involves fostering an environment of academic excellence, innovation, and holistic development for students and faculty alike. my role likely provides a unique platform to shape the future of education while witnessing the transformative growth of individuals and the university. It’s an inspiring position to drive positive change and contribute to society through education Rukmini Knowledge Park, Kattigenahalli, Yelahanka, Bangalore, Karnataka, India, 560 064 © RECT All Rights ReservedWebsite Design and Developmentby Sterco Digitex © RECT All Rights ReservedWebsite Design and Developmentby Sterco Digitex Notices Call Chat Admissions Grand Alumni Meet: 2026 – Nepal Advances in Additive and Subtractive Manufacturing Technologies – Build by Print (AASMT-2026) New Digital Twin for Destination: TerraDT Health and Cancer Screening Camp Report REVA Humanoid - Mascot Naming & Design Competition – Student Submission Guidelines REVA University x Stellantis Present "STELLATHON 2025" International Conference on Language, Literature and Linguistics - ICLLL 2025 REVA University 13th Annual Athletic Meet -2025 (Men &Women) Alumni Connect 2025 REVA University Inter School Badminton Tournament (Men/Women) – 2025

Title: Convocation | REVA University
Content: On the day of Convocation, the students celebrate their academic accomplishments in grandeur. REVA University not only celebrates the achievements of the students but also confers the degrees to graduates, postgraduates and Ph.D. holders on Convocation Day. The convocation ceremony of REVA includes a procession of academic staff and awardees followed by a valediction ceremony. On this occasion, REVA takes time to appreciate the efforts of the future nation builders. Title: REVA University Blocks | REVA University
Content: The administrative building features a stunning welcome area, wonderful décor, cutting-edge meeting rooms and other amenities. It is also considered to be an architectural marvel and is a platinum and LEED-certified building. The schools located in this block offer state-of-the-art facilities to promote teamwork and collaboration among students and educators. It also has fully equipped computer labs and other extensive lab facilities that help students to acquire practical knowledge of technical and scientific principles in their field of study. The interdisciplinary approach of these schools helps to tailor the needs of the students and creates a unique pathway to their future. All the classrooms in the Visvesaraya block are equipped with audio-visual aids, projectors and other relevant digital tools to enhance interactive learning. All Schools in this block exemplify all functions associated with teaching, curriculum planning, student development and research. REVA University always supports leadership and innovation in planning the curriculum, which is executed by the respective schools with great dedication. The technology incubation centre, REVA NEST, is also located in Sir C V Raman Block. It aims to empower and nurture entrepreneurial skills in the students. REVA NEST supports students to incubate start-ups having innovative ideas. The Science block is located adjacent to REVA Business Block and houses RISM and the School of Applied Sciences. It has spacious classrooms and two seminar halls namely APJ Abdul Kalam Seminar hall and Prof. Junjappa Seminar hall. Located adjacent to the administrative block, RBS Block offers an innovative way of studying and learning experience. It provides new social and learning spaces which help students, staff and faculty to work closely together and make valuable connections. RBS Block has spacious classrooms and the building integrates beautifully with the rest of the campus. The spacious Chanakya Auditorium, which houses more than 500 people is located inside RBS block. REVA University has a state-of-the-art library building located amidst greenery and is easily accessible from all parts of the campus. It functions as the primary information resource centre and a repository of printed and electronic resources for teaching, research and related activities in the University. The REVA Library has an exclusive collection of books, including electronic books and periodicals, in addition to textbooks and other reading resources. The library also has an ever-evolving collection of multi-volume reference works, encyclopaedias, fiction, non-fiction, handbooks, research journals, and other materials in addition to textbooksoks needed for each course. Content: Architecture Engineering Innovation Law Management SDG Institution Overall Architecture Engineering Law Management Overall Innovation NIRF 2024-Engineering (Rank Band-201-300) Architecture Engineering Law Management Overall NIRF Ranking 2023 NIRF Innovation Certificate NIRF 2021-Engineering (Rank Band-251-300) Atal Ranking of Institutions on Innovation Achievements (ARIIA), a Ministry of Human Resource Development (MHRD), Govt. of India initiative that ranks universities and higher educational institutes in a systematic manner to make them globally competitive. It ranks educational institutions in terms of the innovation and entrepreneurship ecosystem of the organisation. ARIIA focuses on pioneering ideas to measure the real impact of these innovations both in national and international levels. The ranks are given to inspire Indian educational institutions to encourage Innovation, Entrepreneurship and high-quality research. ARIIA aims to set directions for institutions to encourage them to bring in innovative ideas that help in the social and economic development of the nation. Title: One Day National Symposium On Beginning The Journey Into Oncology And Clinical Research | REVA University
Content: 18 Feb 2026 The Department of Biotechnology, School of Applied Sciences (SoAS), in association with the Bangalore Clinical Research Institute (BCRI), is organizing a One Day National Symposium titled “Beginning the Journey into Oncology and Clinical Research” on 18 February 2026 at REVA University, Bengaluru. This national-level symposium aims to provide undergraduate and postgraduate students, research scholars, and early-career professionals with foundational knowledge and career insights in the rapidly growing fields of oncology and clinical research. The event will feature expert sessions by national and international speakers, focusing on cancer research, clinical trials, regulatory frameworks, and industry expectations. Faculty members and mentors are requested to circulate the brochure widely, share this information within mentee groups, and actively encourage both internal and external students to register and participate. The symposium also includes opportunities for poster and oral research presentations, enabling participants to showcase their research and engage with experts. Interested participants are encouraged to register at the earliest and make use of this valuable platform for learning, networking, and career guidance. Title: REVA University X Stellantis Present "STELLATHON 2025" | REVA University
Content: 05 Dec 2025 Dear Final Year Students, We are excited to announce StellaThon 2025, an exclusive Ideathon hosted by REVA University in collaboration with Stellantis Avtec Powertrain India Pvt. Ltd. (Hosur) , a global leader in the automotive industry. This is your chance to showcase your innovation skills and secure a career with a top-tier automotive company! Theme : Enhancing User Experience in Automotive using AI The Prize : Winners will receive an Internship Offer at Stellantis! Event Details: Date : 5th December 2025 Venue : REVA Rangasthala, REVA University Eligibility : Final Year Students Only Team Size : 2 - 4 Members IMPORTANT NOTE : Participation is strictly limited to Maximum 50 Teams. Registration will be accepted on a First Come, First Serve basis. Once the slots are full, registration will close immediately. Register Your Team Now:https://forms.gle/eM32ErYuCDTEmJni7 Don't miss this opportunity to innovate and get hired! Title: Why REVA | REVA University
Content: For parents, guest faculty, international faculty and delegates visiting the campus, facilities such as fully furnished guest houses with dining and parking area is available inside the campus. REVA faculty are privileged to have access to on-campus residences. Accommodations starting from single units to double to three-bedroom residences are available on the campus. REVA University enables staff to return to work stress-free by adopting a child-centric care and education policy. To ensure the best development of the staff’s child, the two must go hand in hand. REVA University has a Creche facility for the children of staff and faculty within the campus. REVA haswell-plannedsystematically furnished classrooms with digital facilities and learning. The classrooms are designed to facilitate the students withacongenial atmosphere to study. The Central Library is located in the heart of the campus and is housed in an independent building with a carpet area of 3316 Sq. Mts. The Housing blocks are aesthetically built and are situated amidst lush greenery. We, at REVA University, believe that academic learning and sports activities go hand in hand and facilitate sports tournaments for the overall development of our students. Built at Green Park, the open-air theatre holds a variety of cultural programmes by different groups of students representing different states/countries making the evenings more colorful and fascinating. The gazebos that have been set up with great thought and focus for students at the University campus blend outdoor learning, aligned with the Gurukul system of learning of our ancient past apart from offering an experientiallearningexperience. The huge Food Court with a comfortable sitting facility is located along with the brand store. The Food Court offers a variety of brands to cater to everyone’s needs from mouth-watering chats, to North Indian, South Indian, and Chinese dishes, ice cream, juices, and beverages. The National Cadet Corps is the Indian military cadet corps with its Headquarters in New Delhi. It is open to school and college students on a voluntary basis. Another pride of the REVA University campus is its Brand Store located opposite the playground and next to hostels. It contains a variety of REVA branded articles, apparel, University hoodies, gift articles, and a wide range of stationeries. Getting involved in student life through clubs and events can help you form new connections, develop a professional network and enjoy your college life. Taking part in sports and outdoor activities is a great way to keep fit, make friends and unwind after academic work and studies. REVA has outdoor and indoor sports facilities like gymnasium and amenities for Badminton, Table Tennis, Volleyball, Basketball, Football, and Cricket. REVA University has an air-conditioned auditorium that occupies several participants. A regular venue to conduct conferences, workshops and seminars, it offers all the facilities to enhance the learning process and meet various demands of quality education. REVA also has a well-equipped seminar hall that is located on the campus. This facility is used for conducting parents'-teachers' association meetings, get-togethers, seminars, workshops, guest lectures, and other functions. REVA Guest House also known as Atithi offers accommodation for guests including parents, delegates, stakeholders, and invitees of staff members. Title: About University | REVA University
Content: Established in 2012, REVA University is a forerunner in delivering technology-based education. Recognised as one of the Top 50 private universities in India, REVA University, with innovative pedagogy, exemplary infrastructure, and an industry-resilient curriculum that is designed for the future job market, strives to benchmark new milestones in modern education. In less than two decades, the University has grown from a small community of 150 students to a vast institution that is educating and empowering 15,000+ students on campus. REVA University prides itself in contributing to every student's holistic development. UG Programmes PG Programmes Ph.D. Programmes Diploma Programmes Minor and Honours Programmes The University offers programmes in Engineering, Architecture, Science & Technology, Commerce, Management Studies, Law, Liberal Studies and Performing Arts. Courses are offered in Certificate/Diploma and Post Graduate Diploma too. REVA University facilitates research leading to a Doctoral Degree in all disciplines. The programmes offered by REVA University are well-planned and designed based on methodical analysis and research with emphasis on knowledge assimilation, practical applications, hands-on training, global and industrial relevance, and their social significance. REVA University believes in preparing students through the Choice Based Credit System (CBCS) and Continuous Assessment and Grading Pattern (CAGP) of education. The CBCS & CAGP pattern of education has been introduced in all programmes to enable students to opt for subjects of their choice in addition to the core subjects of study and to train them with vocational skills. This methodology helps students earn more credits and facilitates students to pursue additional proficiency certificates and diplomas. The faculty is an active part of the academic dialogue. Teachers and instructors with illustrious academic experience are the architects of the meticulously designed curriculum and programme modules offered at REVA University. They come with industrial exposure and experience that often translates through their teaching, thus bridging the gap between industry and academia. REVA University has an updated, ever-evolving collection of books, journals, and digital content in the library with the latest IT infrastructure that ensures students have information at their disposal. REVA logo depicts ‘Srivatsa’ or “the endless knot”. The Srivatsa has rich significance in Indian Symbolism- in the religions of Hinduism, Buddhism and Jainism. Chief among its varied interpretations is that it represents the interplay of opposite forces in the world and a final merging of the dual, leading to harmony. It binds and connects all the stakeholders- the teacher and the learner at one level; and at another level connects the individual units of the institution to make it a harmonious whole. The ‘endless knot’ signifies the continuous process of learning which has neither a beginning nor an end. In the Tibetan branch of Buddhism the endless knot signifies both wisdom and compassion which are essential in making the teaching-learning process meaningful and productive. Finally, the logo in its digitized version embodies the institution’s blend of tradition and technology – a blend that signifies change and evolution at the individual and collective level and finally the societal level. The lush green campus, state-of-the-art laboratories, custom-designed classrooms to enable seamless learning, and world-class indoor and outdoor sports facilities make REVA University the most preferred university among students and MNCs that visit the campus for placements. Title: Outdoor Learning | REVA University
Content: The gazebos that have been set up with great thought and focus for students at the University campus blend outdoor learning, aligned with the Gurukul system of learning of our ancient past apart from offering an experiential learning experience. This enables the learner to be ahead of others in this competitive world. The gazebos are extensively used for one-to-one learning and teacher interface in a positive learning environment by selective faculty for selective courses. Schools of Performing Arts, Humanities, and Architecture are the major benefactors of the Gazebo learning space. The perfect landscape and soft cape lend the right ambience for learning outdoors for the students. REVA believes that the students apart from their in-depth subject knowledge, need to upkeep themselves with a variety of skills coupled with team spirit and leadership qualities.  It promotes various kinds of activities apart from classroom lectures and lab practices. REVA has an adequate number of auditoriums and seminar halls to facilitate such curricular and co-curricular activities. Title: Beyond Academics | REVA University
Content: To provide IPR education to the faculty and students. To manage innovation and IPR within the framework of curriculum in various programmes. To contribute to socio-economic development through IPR. To develop human resources in the field of Intellectual Property Rights. To create IPR awareness and to implement different programmes in the University. To advise all the faculty and students on the importance of IPR and help them in filing patents and provide necessary guidelines. To provide IPRs protection information, orientation, and facilities to university researchers. To guide & advise faculty and students on how to obtain & sustain patents and help them to approach the patent information centre. To provide goal-oriented research that is targeted towards societal needs and market needs. Based on knowledge of IPR. Patent Filed / Published / Granted Details FY 2021 & 2022 March 5, 2018, saw the beginning of a new journey at REVA University for the young spirited entrepreneurs as REVA signed its partnership agreement with the Entrepreneurship Development Institute of India (EDII), Ahmedabad. EDII is an autonomous and not-for-profit institution, set up in 1983. With this association, REVA University aspires to set up a School of Entrepreneurship and Family Enterprise (SEFE) at REVA offering an Undergraduate programme in Entrepreneurship apart from offering various short-term certification courses under the parasol of SEFE. Our Honourable Chancellor Dr P. Shyama Raju, Vice Chancellor Dr. M. Dhanamjaya of REVA University along with a couple of other directors visited EDII for a quick understanding of the programme structure. The Chancellor in fact interacted with the PG students of EDII apart from the official signing of the memorandum of understanding which took place with the EDII Director Dr Sunil Shukla. Snehal Sampat Jadhav, PG student, Department of Biotechnology, School of Chemical and Biological Sciences, REVA University, has been accepted into the Aspiring Women Entrepreneurs programme, sponsored by the US Department of State and The University of Texas at Austin. Her application has been considered an exceptional application from amongst the young talented women who applied from India. Title: AICTE IDEA Lab | REVA University
Content: REVA University, Bengaluru, is proud to be one of the approved institutes under the prestigious AICTE IDEA (Idea Development Evaluation and Application) Lab initiative by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), New Delhi. The IDEA Lab at REVA University is a state-of-the-art facility dedicated to fostering creativity, enhancing problem-solving abilities, and cultivating an entrepreneurial mindset among students, researchers, and faculty—driving innovation, design excellence, and entrepreneurial growth. This initiative is part of AICTE’s nationwide effort to integrate experiential learning, rapid prototyping, and industry-aligned skill development into engineering and allied programs. Equipped with advanced tools and technologies for digital fabrication, electronics development, 3D printing, CNC machining, and IoT-based product development, the IDEA Lab at REVA University enables: The lab aligns with the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020 by promoting outcome-based education, experiential learning, and industry-relevant skill sets. It acts as a hub for research, product development, and technology-driven entrepreneurship within the REVA University ecosystem This webpage serves as the official reference link for quotation and procurement purposes related to the AICTE IDEA Lab initiative at REVA University. Contact Details Dr. Manjula R. Title: Sports Health And Fitness | REVA University
Content: We, at REVA University, encourage students to participate in various sports that are offered on campus. REVA students have actively participated at the International, National, and State levels in various categories of sports like Cricket, Golf, Football, Tennis, Badminton, Basket Ball, Hockey, Athletics and Swimming. REVAites have also excelled at intercollegiate front as well with accolades in Aquatic meets, Cricket, Basketball, Kabaddi, and Football tournaments. REVA is currently among the top universities for its innovative and most modern facilities in Sports, thanks to the commitment of coaches and physical education instructors. Dr. Prem Kumar G is the Director, Department of Physical Education and Sports at REVA University. A gold medalist in both B.P.Ed and M.P.Ed, he holds a Ph.D. in Physical Education and brings an exceptional blend of academic excellence and practical sports expertise. He brings extensive experience across multiple sports, including Football, Table Tennis, Cricket, and Badminton. An AIFF-certified football professional, Dr. Prem Kumar G is also an active member of the Physical Education Foundation of India (PEFI). His research interests primarily focus on Football and Disability, with publications in reputed Scopus-indexed journals. He has also presented research papers at various national-level conferences. Dr. Prem Kumar G has also contributed significantly to sports administration, including the organization of AIU South Zone tournaments. His leadership continues to enhance sports development, research, student engagement, and athletic performance at National and International level at REVA University. All the sports activities at REVA University are conducted under the supervision of the University Sports Council chaired by Pro Chancellor and mentored by Vice Chancellor. The Director of Physical Education is the Secretary, and all the School Directors are members of this council. The Game Box - REVA Gaming Arcade The Game Box, exclusive to REVA residents, is the gateway to the ultimate gaming adventure. Situated inside the sprawling REVA campus, it consists of Play Station consoles, Foosball, Pool, Carrom, board games, and more. Indoor Sports Outdoor Sports The REVA fitness centre spreads over a sprawling 10,000 sq. ft area and houses some of the most advanced equipment that’s suitable even for professional training. Title: Research | REVA University
Content: Research has always been at the heart of REVA University’s academic mission, driving innovation and knowledge creation. Our specialised research centres build interdisciplinary collaboration, pushing the boundaries of discovery across various domains. REVA University is dedicated to fostering research and innovation, and in the last two decades, we have been committed to developing rich intellectual wealth. In this direction, the Research and Innovation Council at REVA continuously strives to bring in world-class research that will be path-breaking and alter lives along the way. The R & D division aims to continuously liaise with various funding agencies, R&D institutions, industries and faculty members of REVA University to facilitate for undertaking innovative research in cutting-edge areas of application and social relevance. The university has over 700 faculty members engaged in active research in varied areas of specialisations. The majority of these researchers are young and enthusiastic in pursuing research in cutting-edge technologies of social relevance. Title: What are the extracurricular activities organized for students?
Content: There are various extracurricular activities in the campus for students starting from sports to literary to debates, dance and music

Title: Is REVA University a Private University?
Content: Yes, REVA University is a Private University established under REVA University Act 2012.

Title: How can a student apply (application) for Semester End Examination?
Content: The student needs to register in Student portal / Mobile App to apply and submit SEE application. WebLink: https://studentportal.universitysolutions.in/

Title: Where does a student pay Semester End Examination Fee?
Content: The student needs to register in Student portal / Mobile App to submit and pay for SEE Fee WebLink: https://studentportal.universitysolutions.in/

Title: How can results be viewed?
Content: Results are available in both student portal / Mobile App / Website Weblink: https://studentportal.universitysolutions.in/

Title: What is process for Photocopy of Answer Scripts?
Content: Any candidate can apply for the photocopy of the answer script of the examination on payment of appropriate fee within 5 days from the date of the announcement of the results, to the Registrar (Evaluation) office through the respective School office.

Title: What is the process for Re-evaluation?
Content: The student can apply for re-evaluation within 5 days from the date of obtaining the photocopy of the answer script or 10 days from the date of announcement of results (without photocopies).

Title: What is process for Name Correction in Grade Card?
Content: Submission of attested photocopy of 10th std Marks Card, Original Marks Cards (which are to be corrected) and fee paid challan to the COE office through the respective School office.

Title: How can students apply for Duplicate Degree Certificate?
Content: Submission of Affidavit on Rs.50/- stamp paper giving details such as SRN, Month and Year of exam, Course/copy of FIR and fee paid challan to the COE office through the respective School office.

Title: How can Duplicate Grade Card be applied for?
Content: Submission of Affidavit on Rs.50/- stamp paper giving details such as SRN, Month and Year of exam, Course/copy of FIR and fees paid challan to the COE office through the respective school office.

Title: What is the process to apply for Transcript?
Content: Submission of photocopies of marks cards and fee paid challan to the COE office through the respective School office.

Title: How can students apply for Consolidated Grade Card?
Content: Submission of photocopies of marks cards of that particular semester and fee paid challan to the COE office through the respective School office.

Title: What is the process to apply for Provisional Degree Certificate?
Content: Request form giving the details such as SRN, Name of the candidate along with fee paid challan to the COE office to be submitted through the respective School Directors .

Title: Where can grade cards be collected from?
Content: The grade cards can be collected from the respective School office.

Title: Where can I collect Degree certificate from?
Content: The degree certificates can be collected from the respective School office.

Title: Where can a student collect Provisional Degree certificate from?
Content: Students can collect Provisional Degree certificate from the respective School office after submission of duly filled in Request form.

Title: Where can a student collect Transcript?
Content: After printing, the copies will be handed over to respective School office.

Title: Where can students find the Semester End Examination (SEE) time table?
Content: Time-tables are available in both school notice board and in student portal under Time-Table option.

Title: Where can a student find the hall ticket?
Content: Hall ticket can be viewed from student portal under Hall ticket option.

Title: How do students collect the hall tickets?
Content: Hall tickets can be downloaded from the student portal under Hall ticket option.

Title: When is the even semester end examination conducted?
Content: Normally the even semester end examination commences during April / May, where students can appear for the supplementary papers also.

Title: When is the odd semester end examination conducted?
Content: Normally the odd semester end examination commences during Nov / Dec, students can appear for the supplementary papers also.

Title: How to convert CGPA to Percentage?
Content: Conversion Formula CGPA Earned Sum of Credit Point / Sum of Credits CGPA into Percentage : CGPA x 10

Title: How to verify / validate grade card and degree certificate?
Content: Scan QR Code printed on top of grade card or degree certificate and click on the link shown. Validation through student DigiLocker External agencies can verify documents through the link provided on the website (Direct Verify)

Title: How do students understand the Grades and their classification?

Title: Queries (if student)
Content: Kindly contact your respective school exam vertical head or mentor for further assistance or Email: reoffice@reva.edu.in

Title: What is CGPA and how is it calculated?
Content: Overall Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of a candidate after successful completion of the required number of credits is calculated taking into account all the courses undergone by a student over all the semesters of a program, i. e : CGPA = ∑(Ci x Si) / ∑Ci Where Si is the SGPA of the semester and Ci is the total number of credits in that semester.

Title: What is SGPA and how is it calculated?
Content: The SGPA is the ratio of sum of the product of the number of credits with the grade points scored by a student in all the courses taken by a student and the sum of the number of credits of all the courses undergone by a student, i.e., SGPA (Si) = ∑ (Ci x Gi) / ∑Ci Where Ci is the number of credits of the ith course and Gi is the grade point scored by the student in the ith course.

Title: What is Grade Point?
Content: Ans1 : Your GP, is a number that indicates scores earned in various courses. Ans2 : A grade point is a number representing the value of the accumulated final grades earned in courses.

Title: Where can a student collect Transcript from?
Content: Students can collect transcripts from the respective School office after submission of duly filled in Request form.

Title: Training |  REVA University
Content: Our training philosophy is to provide learning opportunities that support and develop students at different stages of their academics. In order to execute this effectively, we collaborate with a range of industries and companies across various sectors. This helps identify training needs and design and facilitate training programmes for students accordingly. Right from the first semester, students undergo mandatory semester-long training integrated with their curriculum. The training modules are constantly upgraded based on research and interactions with recruiters to understand their expectations from students and create an annual roadmap for training. The department executes the training plan after recognizing the core competencies of students and consistently tracks the students’ performance to ensure improvement through periodic assessment. These periodic assessment tests aid students identify their areas of strength which they can upgrade further and their areas of improvement on which they can focus. We have well-planned and structured modules on aptitude, technical skills development, communication and personality development programmes to prepare our students for a highly competitive future. REVA University provides world-class infrastructural facilities to conduct all pre-placement and placement activities. CDC team at REVA are well aware of the fact that for quick employment and absorption of students in the industry, graduating students need to be equipped with good personality and communication skills and great social attitudes. In this context, CDC works with collaborators and partners who work with students from an early stage of their study on technical competency and soft skills. By rigorous practice and training, students are well prepared to face interviews and reach higher levels of internship and absorption by the industry. Listening skills, inter-personal skills, problem solving skills, decision making skills are focussed on through motivation and seminars and workshops To be the preferred choice of major companies and industries, the Training and Placement Cell has specific goals which includes - Rukmini Knowledge Park, Kattigenahalli, Yelahanka, Bangalore, Karnataka, India, 560 064 © RECT All Rights ReservedWebsite Design and Developmentby Sterco Digitex © RECT All Rights ReservedWebsite Design and Developmentby Sterco Digitex Notices Call Chat Admissions Grand Alumni Meet: 2026 – Nepal Advances in Additive and Subtractive Manufacturing Technologies – Build by Print (AASMT-2026) New Digital Twin for Destination: TerraDT Health and Cancer Screening Camp Report REVA Humanoid - Mascot Naming & Design Competition – Student Submission Guidelines REVA University x Stellantis Present "STELLATHON 2025" International Conference on Language, Literature and Linguistics - ICLLL 2025 REVA University 13th Annual Athletic Meet -2025 (Men &Women) Alumni Connect 2025 REVA University Inter School Badminton Tournament (Men/Women) – 2025

Title: Which college is best for AI engineering in Bangalore?
Content: REVA University is widely recognized for its cutting-edge B.Tech program in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. The curriculum is designed with a strong focus on data science, deep learning, and real-world applications, supported by hands-on training, research opportunities, and industry collaborations.

Title: Which college is best for Artificial Intelligence engineering?
Content: If you're looking to build a strong foundation in Artificial Intelligence, REVA University offers one of the most comprehensive programs in Bangalore. With a future-ready syllabus and expert faculty, the university prepares students to thrive in AI-driven industries.

Title: Which institute is best for AI and ML?
Content: REVA University stands out as a leading institute for AI and Machine Learning education. The program blends theoretical concepts with practical exposure through projects, internships, and tech events, helping students become job-ready for roles in AI, data science, and automation.

Title: Which college is good for law in Bangalore?
Content: REVA University’s School of Legal Studies is considered one of the promising law schools in Bangalore. It offers programs like BA LLB, BBA LLB, and LLB with a strong emphasis on legal research, moot courts, internships, and a robust academic environment.

Title: Can I do LLB with 40% marks?
Content: Admission to the LLB program generally requires a minimum of 45% marks in graduation for General Category candidates (as per Bar Council of India norms). If you belong to a reserved category, relaxation in eligibility criteria may apply. It's best to check with the university admissions office for specific details.

Title: Who are eligible for LLB?
Content: To pursue a 3-year LLB program at REVA University, candidates must have completed a bachelor's degree in any discipline from a recognized university with a minimum aggregate of 45% (General), 42% (OBC), or 40% (SC/ST).

Title: Can I do BBA and LLB together?
Content: Yes, REVA University offers an integrated BBA LLB (Hons.) program that combines business administration and law into a five-year course. It’s an excellent choice for students interested in corporate law, entrepreneurship, or legal consultancy.

Title: Is BBA LLB a good degree?
Content: Absolutely. BBA LLB is a strong interdisciplinary degree that opens doors to diverse career paths in corporate law, business, litigation, and government services. At REVA University, the program is designed to equip students with legal knowledge and managerial skills through a balanced academic approach.

Title: Is CLAT compulsory for BBA LLB?
Content: CLAT is not mandatory for admission to BBA LLB at REVA University. Admissions are typically based on merit and performance in the university’s entrance process. However, appearing for CLAT or other law entrance exams may enhance your application profile.

Title: Which college is best for placement in engineering in Bangalore?
Content: REVA University is among the best for engineering placements in Bangalore. With a dedicated Career Development Cell and strong industry tie-ups, REVA consistently helps students secure roles in leading companies like Infosys, TCS, Accenture, and Deloitte across various engineering disciplines.

Title: Which college has 100% placement in Bangalore?
Content: REVA University has achieved close to 100% placement in several engineering streams, particularly in Computer Science and Information Technology. The university’s focus on hands-on learning, real-world projects, and soft skill training prepares students thoroughly for the job market.

Title: Who is the Chancellor of REVA University?
Content: Dr. P. Shyama Raju is the founder and Chancellor of REVA University.

Title: What are the recognitions and approvals that REVA University has?
Content: The details are as below: The University is approved and recognised by University Grants Commission (UGC) Our Engineering and Management programmes are approved by AICTE Our Law Programmes are approved by BCI Our Architecture programmes are approved by COA

Title: Which companies regularly visit for placement at REVA University?
Content: REVA University has 450+ recruiting partners namely Centum, DivyaSree Developers, KPIT, L&T InfoTech, IBM, TCS, Timken, General Motors and Amazon are the few that visit REVA for placements regularly. To see the complete list please visit https://www.reva.edu.in/placement

Title: Is the campus Wifi enabled?
Content: Yes, the campus is Wifi enabled.

Title: Are medical services available on campus?
Content: Yes, REVA University has a Healthcare Centre on campus with 24/7 facilities to take care of students’ health. The University also has an ambulance to meet emergency needs and a tie-up with nearby hospitals.

Title: What are the extracurricular activities organised for students?
Content: There are various extracurricular activities for students on campus. Sports Events Fest - REVOTHSAVA Inter-University competitions Club-related Activities (Club list: https://www.reva.edu.in/clubs-and-societies ) REVA Expo NCC & NSS

Title: Does REVA University offer any add-on Certificate programmes?
Content: Yes, we do offer Certificate Programmes as per industry requirements.

Title: What measures have REVA University taken up to ensure safety on campus?
Content: CCTVs in campus COVID-19 preventive measures and alignment with Govt protocol taken care of Fumigation of campus done Both men and women security guards in campus Women security guards and women wardens for girl students in hostels Buses are safe Sanitisation done periodically No history of any kind of unrest in the campus for the last decade

Title: How is the education system at REVA University?
Content: The curriculum of each programme is designed with a keen eye for detail by emphasising hands-on training, industry relevance, social significance, and practical applications. The University offers world-class facilities and education that meet global standards. We believe in preparing students through the Choice Based Credit System (CBCS) and Continuous Assessment and Grading Pattern (CAGP) of education.

Title: REVA is a big University. Will the students get one-on-one attention for their requirements?
Content: The academic outcome and overall development of the students are given the utmost importance at REVA University. Mentoring programme is designed to initiate a close bonding between the lecturers and students. The mentor will provide necessary inputs to the mentee on work ethics, study habits, time management skills, employability skills, and other essential professional requirements. Thus, REVA University ensures 360-degree student care for every other student in the University.

Title: How future-ready is REVA University?
Content: REVA University follows a blended teaching methodology in which lectures, group discussions, seminars, and digital tools are used. It has timely evolved to the current requisite in industry and the education system. It has enabled Lecture Capturing System (LCS) in the classrooms, Learning Management System – A module for class notes and submitting assignments. Tab-based examinations are used to encourage students to follow the paperless policy.

Title: How does REVA train its students for placements?
Content: Core technical, aptitude, coding, reasoning skills, and verbal ability Company-specific training by the industry veterans Mock aptitude tests and interviews CV building and strengthening corporate links Intensive Soft Skills and Personality Development Training Offering the tools to make students respond effectively.

Content: Yes. If you have any questions about the admissions process or application requirements, or just want to speak to an admissions counsellor to know more about REVA University, you may call 90211 90211/08046966966.

Content: You will be receiving it within 30 working days. It depends on the source through which the transaction was made. If not, you can connect with admissions@reva.edu.in

Title: How can I get the admit card?
Content: After the slot booking, you will be able to download the admit card.

Title: What is slot booking in REVA?
Content: REVA University starts the online REVA CET Slot Booking at REVA’s Online Test Booking System. The candidates have to use their REVA CET 2023 application number and password to enter the REVA OTBS. The slot booking is done on a first come first served basis. After the REVA CET 2023 slot booking, the candidates can check their admit card which is generated 3 days prior to the examination date. The candidates have to download the same and complete the process.

Title: Where will I find all relevant information pertaining to admissions?
Content: For admission procedure details, please check the below link. https://www.reva.edu.in/admission-overview

Title: How does the admission process take place?
Content: The candidate can visit the REVA University website. Click Admissions and then click Apply online or visit https://www.reva.edu.in/new-admissions/ and click Apply Now for the selected programme. You will be guided through the application process and after providing the basic information you can click “Pay Application Fee” and upload the required documents. If you are eligible, you will get an official communication from the REVA University admission team and then tuition can be paid.

Title: What is the refund policy?
Content: For cancellation and refund (if any), write an email to “refund@reva.edu.in”. Refund rules are governed by the UGC Notifications of October 2018.

Title: Can a student apply for UG/PG programme in absence of 10+12/ final year result of graduation?
Content: Yes, a student may apply provisionally for any programme but needs to produce all the original Marksheets/ Degrees at the time of joining the programme. However, for the applicant of the PG Programme, 31st October (of the current academic year) is the last date to submit the original mark sheets/degrees. Your verification will remain incomplete in case you fail to submit the required documents. In the absence of verification, you will not be able to appear for the end semester examination.

Title: Who are foreign students?
Content: Students holding passport issued by foreign countries including people of Indian origin who have acquired the nationality of foreign countries.

Title: Who are NRI students?
Content: Non-Resident Indian students who have studied and passed the qualifying examinations (11th and 12th) from schools or colleges situated in foreign countries (even if affiliated to the Boards of Secondary Education or Universities located in India). Dependants of NRI's studying in India will not be included as NRI students.

Title: What is PIO?
Content: PIO (A Person of Indian Origin) is someone who has settled in foreign countries and is an Indian origin.

Title: What is OCI?
Content: OCI (Overseas citizen of India)- Citizens of India who Live abroad.

Title: Are PIO and OCI Card holding students considered to be equivalent to NRI?
Content: Yes.

Title: Is there a provision for parents to stay in campus?
Content: Yes. REVA Guest House also known as Atithi offers accommodation for guests including parents, delegates, stakeholders, and invitees of staff members. Atithi is situated within the campus premises so that the guests can enjoy all the facilities inside the campus. REVA Guest House provides almost all the facilities such as housekeeping, hot water, parking, healthcare centre, purified water, and many more.

Title: Do you have hostel in the campus?
Content: Yes, we have hostels inside the campus for both boys and girls.

Title: Are the hostel rooms AC or Non AC?
Content: We have both AC and Non AC hostel rooms in campus.

Title: What are the facilities available in Hostel?
Content: Separate hostels for boys and girls. (Single, three, and four sharing) Other conveniences Furnished rooms RO Water in all student hostels Hot water (Solar Heating) Reading room with newspaper & magazines (Girls & Boys) Tutorial room inside the Hostel Writing board in each room 24 hrs. water / electricity Standby Generator

Title: What is the difference between 3 year degree and 4 year degree with Research programmes?
Content: The four-year degree programmes have been introduced as per NEP – 2020. At the end of three years, based on the CGPA of candidates, they will have the options to choose Research/Honours. A candidate has the option to exit after completion of 3 years and take a degree.

Title: Why is REVA University offering a 4-year undergraduate degree programme when other universities are offering 3-year degree programme?
Content: REVA University has been a pioneer in implementing progressive initiatives by the government since its inception. Therefore, in the year 2021 itself, REVA University had introduced 4-year undergraduate degree programmes as per New Education Policy -NEP 2020. All the same, REVA University is also continuing this year with 3 years degree program, which may be discontinued next year.

Title: What is 4-year degree (Honours/Research) as per National Education Policy 2020?
Content: The structure and duration of 4-year Bachelors degree programmes proposed by the NEP 2020 comprise undergraduate degree programmes of either 3 or 4-year duration, with multiple entry and exit points and re-entry options within this period, with appropriate certifications such as: a Certificate after completing 1 year (2 semesters) of study in the chosen fields of study a Diploma after 2 years (4 semesters) of study a Bachelor’s degree after a 3-year (6 semesters) programme of study a Bachelor’s degree with Honours/Research after a 4-year (eight semesters) programme of study (After completing the requirements of a 3-year Bachelors degree, candidates who meet a minimum CGPA of 7.5 will be allowed to continue studies in the fourth year of the undergraduate programme leading to the Bachelors degree (Honours /Research)).

Title: What will be the structure and duration of the Masters programme after a 3- or 4-year undergraduate degree programme as per NEP- 2020?
Content: The NEP 2020 envisages flexibility in the design and duration of the Masters Degree programme. The structure and duration of Masters programmes of study proposed by the NEP 2020 include: A 2-year Masters programme with the second year devoted entirely to research for those who have completed the 3-year Bachelors programme. A 1-year Masters programme for students who have completed a 4-year Bachelors degree (Honours/Research) programme with research.

Title: Is there any minimum eligibility criteria required to opt Honours/Research degree after completion of 3 years?
Content: After the completion of a 3-year course, a candidate must obtain a minimum CGPA of 7.5 to be allowed to continue studies in the fourth year of the undergraduate programme leading to the Bachelors degree with Honours/Research.

Title: What is Academic Bank of Credits (ABC)?
Content: Academic Bank of Credits (ABC) has been established with the purpose of storing the academic credits earned from various recognised HEIs (Higher Education Institutions) so that the degrees from an HEI can be awarded taking into account credits earned. The ABC allows for credit redemption through the process of commuting the acquired credit in the bank accounts maintained in the ABC for the purpose of fulfilling the credit requirement for the award of Certificate/Diploma/Degree by the authorised Universities/Autonomous colleges.

Title: What is the maximum duration to re-enter a programme after an exit to complete the degree?
Content: After seven years, re-entry at various levels as lateral entrants in academic programmes should be based on the earned credits and proficiency test records. Normally, students are expected to complete the four-year undergraduate programme in eight semesters. However, in special circumstances, a student will be permitted an extension, so as to enable her/him to complete all requirements for the degree. The four-year undergraduate programme allows exit and re-entry options for students. It would allow credit accumulation through the facility created by the Academic Bank of Credit (ABC) scheme. The validity of credits earned and kept in the Academic Credit Account would be seven years. After seven years, re-entry into a programme of study will be based on the validation of prior learning outcomes.
